item.title: Tweets of the Week: @karim_douieb
item.description: Challenge accepted! Here is a transition between surface area of US counties and their associated population. This arguably provides a much more accurate reading of the situation. @observablehq notebook: https://t.co/wdfMeV5hO4 #HowChartsLie #DataViz #d3js https://t.co/lStHeeuMUw pic.twitter.com/MpYiXtsHmu â€” Karim DouÃ¯eb (@karim_douieb) October 8, 2019

item.title: Tweets of the Week: @NateSilver
item.description:
A few times a year, I get asked to be a judge of student statistical projects in politics or sports. While the students are very bright, they spend WAY too much time using fancy statistical methods and not enough time framing the right questions and contextualizing their answers.

â€” Nate Silver (@NateSilver538) October 6, 2019

item.title: Tweet of the Week: @drob
